solution_line_template: First find out how many ounces of milk James had to begin with by multiplying the number of gallons by the number of ounces per gallon: {initial_gallons} gallons * {ounces_per_gallon} ounces/gallon = <<{initial_gallons}*{ounces_per_gallon}={initial_ounces}>>{initial_ounces} oz

Now subtract the {drank_ounces} ounces James drank from the initial amount of milk: {initial_ounces} oz - {drank_ounces} oz = <<{initial_ounces}-{drank_ounces}={remaining_ounces}>>{remaining_ounces} oz
